results.title: Sinnui yauman (A Chinese Ghost Story)
results.creator_credit: Cinema City Co, Film Workshop, Tsui Hark and Ching Siu-tung
results.brief_description: Leslie Cheung stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Cinema City Co, Film Workshop, Tsui Hark and Ching Siu-tung
results.description: Leslie Cheung (Happy Together) stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon. Enlisting the help of a mysterious Taoist monk (Wu Ma), the young tax collector tries to free the girl’s spirit and lay it to rest before her eminent marriage to the evil mountain demon. Employing rapid editing, surreal imagery (including a demon with a giant killer tongue) and spectacular fight sequences, ‘A Chinese ghost story’ is a fine example of the kinetic energy and outlandish sensibility that is a staple of the Hong Kong fantasy genre. Also starring Joi Wang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.
description_for_label: Leslie Cheung (Happy Together) stars as Ning Tsai-Shen, a timid tax collector who happens upon the haunted Lan Ro temple where he meets and falls in love with Nieh Hsiao-Tsing a restless ghost (Joey Wong) whose soul is being held captive by a hideous tree demon. Enlisting the help of a mysterious Taoist monk (Wu Ma), the young tax collector tries to free the girl’s spirit and lay it to rest before her eminent marriage to the evil mountain demon. Employing rapid editing, surreal imagery (including a demon with a giant killer tongue) and spectacular fight sequences, ‘A Chinese ghost story’ is a fine example of the kinetic energy and outlandish sensibility that is a staple of the Hong Kong fantasy genre. Also starring Joi Wang. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Drunken Master
results.creator_credit: Seasonal Film Corporation, Zhang Quan and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.brief_description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master.

constellations_other.name: Jason Phu and genre-bending kung fu films
constellations_other.description: Analects of Kung Phu work is a philosophical guide to life via martial arts films, drawing on his interest in Vietnamese and Chinese folklore, which inspires many of the films featured in this Constellation.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Seasonal Film Corporation, Zhang Quan and Yuen Woo-Ping
results.description: This 1978 Hong Kong film, one of the earliest to star Jackie Chan, highlights the relationship between a student and his martial arts master. Wong Fei Hung, played by Chan, is a 19th Century folk hero in Chinese culture and cinema, a master of kung fu who fights the injustice of British colonialism (this character would later be portrayed by Jet Li in ‘Once upon a time in China’). Drunken Master finds Wong in his early years as a troublesome fighter who is sent to his uncle, the hard-drinking title character, for instruction in discipline and martial arts. After enduring torturous training, Wong runs away only to encounter some local villains. Being badly beaten, he returns to his uncle who finally trains him in “drunken style” kung fu. Cast includes: Jackie Chan, Simon Yuen and Lam Yin.

results.title: Ariarne Titmus’ coach Dean Boxall on her winning gold
results.brief_description: Australians were in a frenzy of excitement when Ariarne Titmus won gold in the women’s 400m freestyle in her Olympic debut in Tokyo. Managing to dethrone previous Olympic medallist Katie Ledecky, Titmus later spoke of the pain and years of dedication it took to win. Knowing her journey full well, no one else was more ecstatic than her coach, Dean Boxell.
results.title_for_label: Ariarne Titmus’ coach Dean Boxall on her winning gold
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Australians were in a frenzy of excitement when Ariarne Titmus won gold in the women’s 400m freestyle in her Olympic debut in Tokyo. After dethroning defending champion Katie Ledecky, Titmus revealed the years of dedication it took to win, telling Sunrise: “Physically, it’s a lot of training. On the days that I’m at the pool twice a day I could be there up to seven or eight hours and Dean is there a lot longer.”

Knowing her journey full well, no one else was more ecstatic than her coach, Dean Boxell, whose enthusiastic celebration was thrust into the limelight across social media.

Boxell was captured enthusiastically dancing, punching the air, screaming in joy, and yes, air-humping the glass barrier in celebration. His vigorous outpouring almost immediately went viral, spreading across local news, Twitter and Instagram after countless Olympic viewers filmed their TV screens and shared it online. Many were right there with him, finding his gut reaction honest, endearing and typically Australian.

But others found the display over the top and offensive, leading to a backlash from some Twitter users, especially Americans. Was this something that only Australian audiences could understand? Or was this an example of inflated male privilege? Titmus certainly didn’t mind at all and was thrilled to share the moment with her fervently loyal coach, who was inspired by his favourite wrestler from childhood, Ultimate Warrior.

“He is my favourite. I used to wrestle with my brother … I loved the Ultimate Warrior,” he has said.
description_for_label:
This responsive display presents the moment, stories ad memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

Australians were in a frenzy of excitement when Ariarne Titmus won gold in the women’s 400m freestyle in her Olympic debut in Tokyo. After dethroning defending champion Katie Ledecky, Titmus revealed the years of dedication it took to win. Knowing her journey full well, no one was more excited than coach Dean Boxell, whose celebration was thrust into the limelight across social media.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → MM-09. Catch of the Day

results.title: Jeff Bezos post-launch brief
results.brief_description:
Following Jeff Bezos’ launch into space on the New Shephard rocket ship, the billionaire took a moment to thank those who had made it possible. The ten-minute, $5.5 billion trip was essentially bankrolled by Amazon customers and employees – the latter of whom are renowned for being criminally overworked and underpaid. During a period of historic inequality, a billionaire blasting off a planet ravaged by the climate crisis and a pandemic seemed tone-deaf at best, villainous at worst.

It also wasn’t lost on many social media users how phallic the New Shephard’s shape seemed to be, generating an avalanche of quips suggesting Bezos was overcompensating for… something. Naturally, the internet didn’t take long to compare the New Shephard to the rocket launched by Dr Evil in Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me. While these jokes may seem throw-away moments of internet culture, they, like others referencing his recent divorce, use humour and absurdity to bring Bezos back down to earth. And the backlash isn’t only against the Amazon founder, but also Richard Branson and Elon Musk, billionaires jostling to beat each other into the stratosphere in a space race that exposes how massive corporations and individuals now possess the resources to do what was once reserved for Cold War superpowers. While Bezos timed the launch on the anniversary of the 1969 Moon landing, many Twitter users noted the disparity between that globally unifying moment and the disillusionment of watching a man who could end poverty take an intergalactic joyride.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → MM-09. Catch of the Day

results.title: Eye of fire
results.brief_description: A gas leak in an underwater pipeline caused an oceanic fireball dubbed ‘The Eye of Fire’ in the Gulf of Mexico. The state owned company is investigating the causes.

constellations_other.name: Deep blue
constellations_other.description: Go deep on an exploration of real world oceans and those rendered by pixels and creatures made from plastics.

results.title_for_label: ‘Eye of fire’ in the Gulf of Mexico
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In horrific scenes that seemed more like footage from an action movie than the real world, the ocean was literally on fire on 3 July 2021 in the Gulf of Mexico. The huge fireball blazing across the sea surface was caused by a gas leak from an underwater pipeline, which social media users dubbed ‘the eye of fire’. The video was shared across the internet as further evidence of the environmental tolls of capitalism and the irresponsibility of fossil fuel companies plundering natural resources and producing unnatural results.
description_for_label:
This responsive display presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In astonishing scenes, the ocean was literally on fire on 3 July 2021 in the Gulf of Mexico. The fireball blazing across the sea surface, dubbed the ‘eye of fire’ by social media users, was caused by an underwater gas leak from a pipeline. The video spread across the internet as further evidence of fossil fuel companies plundering natural resources and producing unnatural results.

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → MM-09. Catch of the Day

results.title: Israeli air raid on building housing international media
results.material_description: screen recording of @AJEnglish’s Twitter Digital screen recording from @AJEnglish's Twitter
results.brief_description: In the sixth consecutive day of hostilities between Israel and Hamas, Israeli airstrikes bombed a 15-storey block in the heart of Gaza that housed private homes and workplaces as well as the offices of media organisations Al Jazeera and the Associated Press. Defending the attack, Israeli officials stated that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell out in the building yet AP executive editor Sally Buzbee has called for an independent inquiry into the strike stating that this attack destroyed the ability for news reporting in the territory vehemently fighting for the world’s right to know. “This is an important story and because of the actions yesterday, the world is going to know less.”
results.title_for_label: Israeli air raid on building housing international media
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

In the sixth consecutive day of attacks between Israeli and Palestinian forces, Israel bombed a 15-storey block in Gaza City claiming that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell in the building. Along with the private homes and workplaces in the building, it housed the offices of media organisations Al Jazeera and the Associated Press who were given advance warning of the bombing. Al Jazeera broadcast live, in real time, footage of their own offices being destroyed which went viral changing the international coverage of the ongoing Israel-Palestine conflict. AP executive editor Sally Buzbee has called for an independent inquiry into the strike, stating “This is an important story and because of the actions yesterday, the world is going to know less.”
description_for_label: In the sixth consecutive day of attacks between Israeli and Palestinian forces, Israel bombed an office building in Gaza City, claiming that Hamas was operating an intelligence cell in the building. Along with private homes and workplaces, the building housed the offices of Al Jazeera and the Associated Press, who were given advance warning of the bombing. Al Jazeera and the AP broadcast live footage of their own offices being destroyed, which went viral and changed the international coverage of the conflict.

results.title: Convicted on all charges
results.brief_description: The murder of George Floyd by a Minneapolis police officer was captured on video and incited waves of protests in the US and around the world. When the jury swiftly and unanimously convicted the officer of all charges, huge crowds gathered to pay their respects to Floyd at the intersection where he took his last breaths. Minnesota’s attorney general, Keith Ellison welcomed the conviction stating, “This verdict reminds us that we must make enduring… enduring systemic, societal change.” Three other officers face trial for aiding and abetting murder and manslaughter. Key to securing the conviction was a video taken by a bystander.
results.description:

results.title: Grace Tame’s address to the National Press Club
results.brief_description: When Australian of the Year Grace Tame, an activist and advocate for survivors of sexual assault, was asked what she thought of Prime Minister Scott Morrison’s response ‘as a father’ to rape allegations made by Brittany Higgins, Tame did not mince her words. Herself a survivor of child sexual abuse and influential in the Let Her Speak Campaign, Tame used the National Press Club address to call on fellow survivors, saying “Share your truth, it is your power. One voice, your voice, and our collective voices can make a difference”.
results.title_for_label: Grace Tame’s address to the National Press Club

details.label: Curatorial section
display_values: The Story of the Moving Image → Moving Minds → MM-09. Catch of the Day

results.title: Trump supporters minding the velvet ropes
results.material_description: Digital screen recording from C-Span's YouTube channel
results.brief_description: After years of consuming viral misinformation, pro-Trump insurgents stormed the US Capitol building in early 2021, pausing their vandalising and looting only to take selfies, as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet ropes, despite dismissing democracy.

constellations_other.name: Fake news: too little too late
constellations_other.description: Unbound Creations’ Headliner: NoviNews explores the impact of the media and fake news on society, something that is fast becoming one of the biggest concerns of our age.

results.title_for_label: Screen recording of C-Span’s news footage ‘Trump supporters minding the velvet ropes’
results.description:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

For several hours on 6 January 2021, pro-Tromp insurgents occupied and vandalised the US Capitol building to protest his 2020 presidential election defeat. It was the grim climax of Trump’s “Save America” rally, where he incited the mob to “take back our country”. After years of consuming viral misinformation and conspiracy theories, the rioters enthusiastically played out their apocalyptic fantasies, taking pictures and selfies amidst the mayhem as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet guide ropes, despite showing little care for democracy or the five people who died from the event.
description_for_label:
This video features in a responsive display in the museum that presents the moments, stories and memes capturing the zeitgeist by going viral on the internet.

After years of consuming viral misinformation and conspiracy theories, the rioters enthusiastically played out their apocalyptic fantasies, taking pictures and selfies amidst the mayhem as if part of a legitimate sightseeing tour. They even obeyed the velvet guide ropes, despite showing little care for democracy or the five people who died from the event.

results.title: [Phillip Annett Home Movie]
results.brief_description:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.

Selected highlights list (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:00:03:00 Close-up of men’s faces as they walk past the camera, waving their hats and gesturing. Great snapshot of the period and fashion.
00:00:07:00 Men walking towards camera showing great examples of 1940s fashion, streetscape and vintage cars
00:00:33:00 People in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup and The Sun advertising in the background
00:00:45:00 Two men in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup advertising in the background
00:00:46:00 Man in the street with vintage Myer delivery truck in background
00:00:47:00 Men with baby in vintage pram showing excellent examples of men’s fashion
00:00:56:00 Two men in RAAF Uniforms walk towards and past the camera
00:01:08:00 Man walks towards camera and waves with vintage cars beside him in the street
00:01:14:00 Two school boys holding hands walk down the street towards the camera
00:01:19:00 Young man riding towards camera on his bicycle, he waves. Good example of streetscape.
00:01:21:00 Man in the street smoking a pipe with vintage cars in the background
00:01:24:00 Small boy points and shoots a toy gun showing good example of children’s fashion
00:01:25:00 Two children run down the footpath. Good children’s fashion and street view.
00:01:28:00 Boy and girl stand on footpath and blow kisses
00:01:32:00 Sequence of images showing various individuals standing outside their houses. Good example of houses and street.
00:01:34:00 Old man wearing trousers and braces walking down the footpath
00:01:43:00 Exterior images of period houses
00:01:55:00 View of Government House from the interior of a car as they drive under a bridge
00:02:00:00 Lindberg and Foster signage
00:02:04:00 Sequence of images of women walking, towards and past the camera waving. Good fashion reference.
00:02:11:00 Woman with pram and baby walking down the street
00:02:13:00 Women walking down the street showing great fashion examples
00:02:49:00 Show pony/horse in backyard with show ribbons adorning its back. Impressed onlookers observe the prize winner of the 1949 Coast National Exhibition.
00:03:33:00 A man and a woman walk down a country road, a vintage car drives past in the background
00:03:43:00 Diggers Rest Post Office and General Store
00:03:45:00 People standing in rural setting country Victoria
00:04:36:00 Royal Melbourne Show fire truck display in main arena including Northwood Park fire truck with woodchopping in background
00:05:12:00 Royal Melbourne Show horse riding and woodchopping display
00:05:28:00 Harness racing display at Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:37:00 Horse riding and horse flag and barrel event Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:49:00 Girl on dapple grey horse riding in front of stables at the Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:59:00 Inner Melbourne street scenes, possibly Parkville
00:06:26:00 McInerney’s Hotel Max, Victoria Bitter, Orlando Wines signage on exterior brick wall. Great vintage car and period houses in front of sign.
00:06:29:00 Children in birthday party fashion attire
00:07:04:00 Children in party fashion outfits in suburban backyard with Hills Hoist, mums join in the fun
00:07:28:00 Men and women display great hair fashion of the day as they walk towards camera
00:07:37:00 Children at the birthday party stand under the Hills Hoist and watch a man riding a child’s three-wheel bike
00:07:41:00 Older man leads the birthday party children under the Hills Hoist. Good fashion reference for children.
00:07:55:00 Black and white horse and cart in front of Mynor Fruit Cup advertising. Man in bowler hat and braces runs back and forth and kicks his legs in the air. Great old footage from the time.
00:08:05:00 Women standing in front of sign for the Narbethong Blacks Spur Hotel
00:08:19:00 Man in uniform walks along the street outside pub/hotel
00:08:23:00 Two men talking in front of pub smiling and laughing. Good street and fashion scene in front of a pub/hotel.
00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
00:08:39:00 North Road City St Kilda Road bus
00:08:45:00 Melbourne number 7 945 tram to the city with signage “Ride in Comfort travel between 9.30 and 4.00”
00:09:01:00 Women exiting the pub/hotel onto the street. Good fashion reference.

00:08:19:00 Man in uniform walks along the street outside pub/hotel
00:08:23:00 Two men talking in front of pub smiling and laughing. Good street and fashion scene in front of a pub/hotel.
00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
00:08:39:00 North Road City St Kilda Road bus
00:08:45:00 Melbourne number 7 945 tram to the city with signage “Ride in Comfort travel between 9.30 and 4.00”
00:09:01:00 Women exiting the pub/hotel onto the street. Good fashion reference.
description_for_label:
This home movie was originally created on 16mm film by Phillip Annett. It was donated to ACMI by Daryl Annett.

This film is a snap shot of suburban life in Melbourne. There are wonderful examples of fashion, inner-Melbourne street scenes, architecture and cars of the time. We see a children’s birthday party and backyard games under the Hills Hoist as well as neighbours chatting over the fence to passers-by in the street. Men in Australian Army and Air Force uniforms pose and smile for the camera, and there are scenes of a road trip to regional Victoria. We see a fire truck display, horse and harness riding as well as woodchopping displays at the Royal Melbourne Show. There are candid images of a horse event competitor in the stables area of the Royal Melbourne Show, as well as St Kilda Road buses and trams as they travel down the road. Black and white images of a horse and cart and a man in a bowler hat performing tricks is a fantastic moment in time.

Selected highlights list (timecodes from Access Overscan)

00:00:03:00 Close-up of men’s faces as they walk past the camera, waving their hats and gesturing. Great snapshot of the period and fashion.
00:00:07:00 Men walking towards camera showing great examples of 1940s fashion, streetscape and vintage cars
00:00:33:00 People in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup and The Sun advertising in the background
00:00:45:00 Two men in the street with Mynor Fruit Cup advertising in the background
00:00:46:00 Man in the street with vintage Myer delivery truck in background
00:00:47:00 Men with baby in vintage pram showing excellent examples of men’s fashion
00:00:56:00 Two men in RAAF Uniforms walk towards and past the camera
00:01:08:00 Man walks towards camera and waves with vintage cars beside him in the street
00:01:14:00 Two school boys holding hands walk down the street towards the camera
00:01:19:00 Young man riding towards camera on his bicycle, he waves. Good example of streetscape.
00:01:21:00 Man in the street smoking a pipe with vintage cars in the background
00:01:24:00 Small boy points and shoots a toy gun showing good example of children’s fashion
00:01:25:00 Two children run down the footpath. Good children’s fashion and street view.
00:01:28:00 Boy and girl stand on footpath and blow kisses
00:01:32:00 Sequence of images showing various individuals standing outside their houses. Good example of houses and street.
00:01:34:00 Old man wearing trousers and braces walking down the footpath
00:01:43:00 Exterior images of period houses
00:01:55:00 View of Government House from the interior of a car as they drive under a bridge
00:02:00:00 Lindberg and Foster signage
00:02:04:00 Sequence of images of women walking, towards and past the camera waving. Good fashion reference.
00:02:11:00 Woman with pram and baby walking down the street
00:02:13:00 Women walking down the street showing great fashion examples
00:02:49:00 Show pony/horse in backyard with show ribbons adorning its back. Impressed onlookers observe the prize winner of the 1949 Coast National Exhibition.
00:03:33:00 A man and a woman walk down a country road, a vintage car drives past in the background
00:03:43:00 Diggers Rest Post Office and General Store
00:03:45:00 People standing in rural setting country Victoria
00:04:36:00 Royal Melbourne Show fire truck display in main arena including Northwood Park fire truck with woodchopping in background
00:05:12:00 Royal Melbourne Show horse riding and woodchopping display
00:05:28:00 Harness racing display at Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:37:00 Horse riding and horse flag and barrel event Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:49:00 Girl on dapple grey horse riding in front of stables at the Royal Melbourne Show
00:05:59:00 Inner Melbourne street scenes, possibly Parkville
00:06:26:00 McInerney’s Hotel Max, Victoria Bitter, Orlando Wines signage on exterior brick wall. Great vintage car and period houses in front of sign.
00:06:29:00 Children in birthday party fashion attire
00:07:04:00 Children in party fashion outfits in suburban backyard with Hills Hoist, mums join in the fun
00:07:28:00 Men and women display great hair fashion of the day as they walk towards camera
00:07:37:00 Children at the birthday party stand under the Hills Hoist and watch a man riding a child’s three-wheel bike
00:07:41:00 Older man leads the birthday party children under the Hills Hoist. Good fashion reference for children.
00:07:55:00 Black and white horse and cart in front of Mynor Fruit Cup advertising. Man in bowler hat and braces runs back and forth and kicks his legs in the air. Great old footage from the time.
00:08:05:00 Women standing in front of sign for the Narbethong Blacks Spur Hotel

00:08:23:00 Two men talking in front of pub smiling and laughing. Good street and fashion scene in front of a pub/hotel.
00:08:30:00 Two women walk along the street pushing a woman in a wheel chair. They pass a Reckitts Blue advertising sign on a brick wall.
